intro: Tecticornia disarticulata, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant features small, yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring, and its leaves are usually narrow and succulent to reduce water loss. Tecticornia disarticulata has a shallow root system, allowing it to thrive in nutrient-poor environments. It is well adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a hardy species in harsh climates.
